com.pb.sawdust.tabledata.read

Class AbstractSubTableReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pb.sawdust.tabledata.read.AbstractTableReader
      • com.pb.sawdust.tabledata.read.AbstractSubTableReader
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SubTableReader, TableReader
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    FileTableReader

    public abstract class AbstractSubTableReader
extends AbstractTableReader
implements SubTableReader
    The AbstractSubTableReader is a skeletal SubTableReader easing the programming burden on sub-table reader implementations.

    • Field Summary

    • Field Detail

      • columnsToKeep

        protected int[] columnsToKeep
        Array of (0-based) indices of the columns to keep. Will be null if all columns are to be kept.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractSubTableReader

        Constructor specifying the table name.
        Parameters:
        tableName - The name to use for the table.

    • Method Detail

      • getAllColumnNames

        protected abstract java.lang.String[] getAllColumnNames()
        Get all of the column names in the table (as opposed to just those for the columns being kept). User defined data types (via setColumnNames(String...) will override these values; nonetheless, this method should always return valid names for each column. Changes to the columns to keep will cause the reader to use the names returned from this method until a user overrides them; that is, these names form the default names for the table.
        Returns:
        the names of all of the columns in the table, in the order that they occur.

      • getAllColumnTypes

        protected abstract DataType[] getAllColumnTypes()
        Get all of the column types in the table (as opposed to just those for the columns being kept). User defined data types (via setColumnTypes(DataType...) will override these values; nonetheless, this method should always return valid types for each column. Changes to the columns to keep will cause the reader to use the types returned from this method until a user overrides them; that is, these types form the default types for the table.
        Returns:
        the types of all of the columns in the table, in the order that they occur.

      • getDataIterator

        protected abstract java.util.Iterator<java.lang.Object[]> getDataIterator()
        Get an Iterator which iterates over all the rows of data in the table, in their correct order. The arrays of data should contain all of the columns (not just those from the columns to be kept) and each data element should be of the correct type corresponding to its column's data type. Data in the array corresponding to columns which are not going to be kept will be ignored, so correctly typing those elements is unnecessary. Because column types may be set externally, the typing should be performed using a combination of getColumnTypes() and columnsToKeep, not getAllColumnTypes().
        Returns:
        an iterator which cycles over all of the rows in the table.

      • setAllColumnNames

        public void setAllColumnNames(java.lang.String... allColumnNames)
        Set all of the column names in the source table. This is useful to use if column names need to be referenced or set and getAllColumnNames is too expensive or does not return the desired names.
        Parameters:
        allColumnNames - An arry of all of the column names in the source table.

      • setColumnsToKeep

        public void setColumnsToKeep(int... columns)
        Description copied from interface: SubTableReader
        Set the columns to keep by specifying the columns' indices. Calls to this function will override all previous calls to setColumnsToKeep(int...), setColumnsToKeep(String...), or resetColumnsToKeep(). The order of columns specifies the order of the columns in the DataTable created by this reader.
        Specified by:
        setColumnsToKeep in interface SubTableReader
        Parameters:
        columns - The (0-based) indices of the columns to keep.

      • setColumnsToKeep

        public void setColumnsToKeep(java.lang.String... columns)
        Description copied from interface: SubTableReader
        Set the columns to keep by speifying the columns' labels. Calls to this function will override all previous calls to setColumnsToKeep(int...), setColumnsToKeep(String...), or resetColumnsToKeep(). The order of columns specifies the order of the columns in the DataTable created by this reader.
        Specified by:
        setColumnsToKeep in interface SubTableReader
        Parameters:
        columns - The labels of the columns to keep.

        (Re)set the reader to keep all columns from the table.

      • setRowsToKeep

        public void setRowsToKeep(Filter<java.lang.Integer> rowFilter)
        Description copied from interface: SubTableReader
        Set a row index filter which will be used to determine rows to keep. If the filter, which takes the (0-based) index of the row, returns true, the row will be kept. This filter is used in conjuction with (not as a replacement for) the rows specified to be kept by calls to setRowsToKeep(Filter<Object[]>).
        Specified by:
        setRowsToKeep in interface SubTableReader
        Parameters:
        rowFilter - A row index filter which specifies if a row is to be kept or not.

      • setRowFilter

        public void setRowFilter(Filter<java.lang.Object[]> rowFilter)
        Description copied from interface: SubTableReader
        Set a row data filter which will be used to determine rows to keep. If the filter, which takes an object array of row data (including all columns, not just those to be kept in the returned table data), returns true, the row will be kept. This filter is used in conjuction with (not as a replacement for) the rows specified to be kept by calls to setRowsToKeep(Filter<Integer>).
        Specified by:
        setRowFilter in interface SubTableReader
        Parameters:
        rowFilter - A row data filter which specifies if a row is to be kept or not.

      • resetRowsToKeep

        public void resetRowsToKeep()
        Description copied from interface: SubTableReader
        (Re)set the reader to keep all rows from the table.
        Specified by:
        resetRowsToKeep in interface SubTableReader

      • getRowsToKeepFilter

        protected Filter<java.lang.Integer> getRowsToKeepFilter()
        Get the filter used to determine which rows (by index) to skip.
        Returns:
        the row index filter, or null if there is none.

      • getColumnNames

        public java.lang.String[] getColumnNames()
        Description copied from class: AbstractTableReader
        Get the names of the columns, in the order that they appear in the data table. As required by DataTable, each column name should be unique. Will return null if the column names have not been set yet; in such a situation an extending class should either determine the column names or throw an exception of some sort (null should never be returned to and end user from this method).
        Specified by:
        getColumnNames in interface SubTableReader
        Specified by:
        getColumnNames in interface TableReader
        Overrides:
        getColumnNames in class AbstractTableReader
        Returns:
        the names of the columns in the table.

      • getColumnTypes

        public DataType[] getColumnTypes()
        Description copied from class: AbstractTableReader
        Get the column types, in the order that they appear in the table. Will return null if the column types have not been set yet; in such a situation an extending class should either determine the column types or throw an exception of some sort (null should never be returned to and end user from this method).
        Specified by:
        getColumnTypes in interface SubTableReader
        Specified by:

        Overrides:

        Returns:
        the types of the column in the table.

      • getData

        public java.lang.Object[][] getData()
        Description copied from interface: SubTableReader
        Get the table data, organized by rows. The data should be structured such that it conforms to the parameter specification in DataTable.addDataByRow(Object[][]). This function will return only the rows which are specifiedto be kept and which pass the row filter specified by setRowFilter(Filter<Object[]>), and each row of data will only contain those columns specified to be kept.
        Specified by:
        getData in interface SubTableReader
        Specified by:
        getData in interface TableReader
        Returns:
        the table data.
